{{Refimprove|date=May 2008}} {{distinguish|Pieter van Abeele}} '''Pieter Van den Abeele''' is a computer programmer,<ref> {{cite web |url=http://news.zdnet.com/2100-9593-5546033-3.html |title=Sun poised to take open-source Solaris step | Tech News on ZDNet |publisher=news.zdnet.com |accessdate=2008-05-28 |last= |first= }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} </ref> and the founder of the [[PowerPC]]-version of [[Gentoo Linux]], a foundation connected with a distribution of the [[Linux]] computer operating system.{{Clarify me|date=February 2009}} He joined Gentoo shortly after its conception, merging Gentoo's first port into the mainline Gentoo repository, paving the way for other [[Gentoo Linux]] ports by implementing amongst many other things the Gentoo architecture keywords and portage profiles. Working together with [[Daniel Robbins]], Pieter spearheaded the Gentoo architectures and platforms effort. He founded Gentoo for [[Mac OS X]], for which he received a scholarship by [[Apple Computer]]. In 2004 Pieter was invited to the [[OpenSolaris]] pilot program and assisted [[Sun Microsystems]] with building a development eco-system around the [[Solaris operating system]]. Pieter was nominated for the OpenSolaris Community Advisory Board and managed a team of developers to make Gentoo available on the Solaris operating system as well. Pieter is a co-author of the Gentoo [[Social Contract]] and a co-author of the [http://www.gentoo.org/doc/en/handbook/ Gentoo handbook].
The teams managed by Pieter Van den Abeele have shaped the [[PowerPC]] landscape with several "firsts". Gentoo/PowerPC was the first distribution to introduce PowerPC Live CDs. Gentoo also beat Apple to releasing a full [[64-bit]] PowerPC userland environment for the IBM [[PowerPC 970]] (G5) processor.
Pieter Van den Abeele's academic work at the [[Vrije Universiteit Brussel]], [[Belgium]], involves the redesign of the technology at the heart of [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]; [[Portage (software)|Portage]]. His Gentoo-based Home Media and Communication System, based on a [[Freescale Semiconductor]] [[PowerPC_G4#PowerPC_7447.2F7457_.22Apollo_7.22|PowerPC 7447]] processor won the Best of Show award at the inaugural 2005 Freescale Technology Forum in Orlando, Florida. Pieter is also a member of the [[Power.org]] consortium and participates in committees and workgroups focusing on disruptive business plays around the [[Power Architecture]]. Pieter Van den Abeele is also a founding member of the [http://www.metapkg.com MetaPkg alliance] between Gentoo, Apple's [[OpenDarwin]] and [[Fink]], to coordinate porting efforts.
